subject: Home & DIY
title: The Hub vs Hubless Debate
description: A quick win: understand The Hub vs Hubless Debate.

hook.text: Some smart homes use a hub to control everything. Others connect each device to Wi-Fi. Both approaches have fatal flaws.

buildup.text: A hub like SmartThings acts as a translatorâ€”it speaks to Zigbee, Z-Wave, and Wi-Fi devices in their native tongues.

discovery.text: Hubless devices connect straight to your router. Easy to set up, but each adds load. Over 30 can crash your network.

twist.text: If the hub dies, your smart home goes dark. If the router fails in a hubless setup, same result. One weak link.

climax.text: Matter aims to fix this with a universal standard. Devices will work across any hub or go hubless seamlessly.

punchline.text: Every smart home has one dumb failure point.

quiz.question: What is a major risk of a hub-based smart home system?
options: If the hub fails, the entire smart home stops working
Hubs can only control a maximum of 5 devices
Hub-based systems cannot connect to the internet
